course_title: Research Seminar in Information Systems II
course_description: The goal of this course is to introduce first/second year doctoral students to business research in general and information systems (IS) research in particular. The underlying theme of the course will be the application of economic theories, models and empirical analyses to business problems impacted by information technology.  We shall study topical areas including the IT productivity paradox, pricing and price-dispersion in electronic markets, pricing of digital products and information and the emergence of privacy as an economic concept.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the PhD program.
sections: Class Nbr: 4892, Section #: 5101, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: Does Not Meet, Instructor: R. Chellappa, Status: Open
